value.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Describe the compliance management capabilities in Microsoft
value.excerpt: Describe the compliance management capabilities in Microsoft

value.title: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365

value.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
value.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

value.title: Understand the evolving world of data
value.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

value.title: Execute an Azure Function with triggers
value.excerpt: This module demos some of the most common types of triggers for executing Azure Functions and how to configure them to execute your logic.

value.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
value.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

value.title: Introduction to AI technology
value.excerpt: Learn the primary concepts and technologies of AI, and how Microsoft is turning the latest AI into tools, products, and services that organizations can leverage

value.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure Kubernetes open-source container-orchestration system for automating application deployment, scaling, and management.

value.title: Safeguard your environment with Azure Advanced Threat Protection
value.excerpt: Learn about the Azure Advanced Threat Protection component of Microsoft Threat Protection.

value.title: Monitor GitHub events by using a webhook with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of webhooks when you trigger an Azure function with a GitHub webhook and parse the payload for insights.

value.title: Move Azure resources to another resource group
value.excerpt: Learn how to identify Azure resources you can move, and how to move them to a new resource group.

value.title: Understand common concepts in Rust
value.excerpt: Learn about Rust concepts such as variables, data types, structs, enums, functions, indexing, hash maps, and flow control.

value.title: Secure your application by using OpenID Connect and Azure AD
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to enable users to authenticate in multiple systems by using their Azure AD identities.

value.title: Store application data with Azure Blob storage
value.excerpt: Discover how to build an app that stores user files with Azure Blob storage, use Blob storage in a web app, and use the Azure Storage SDK for .NET Core.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Manage services with the Azure portal
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure cloud platform through the Azure portal, where you create and manage all of your Azure resources.

value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5vS7Iq9vpXE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Go serverless: Event-driven applications with Azure Functions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeff Hollan joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can quickly develop and deploy code to run in the cloud with Azure Functions. Functions can be written in a variety of languages, and will automatically trigger and scale based on your application needs.  1:53 - Demo  Quickstart: Create your first function

value.title: How to build a CI/CD pipeline for API Management, Part 1 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Miao Jiang joins Scott Hanselman to walk through a conceptual framework for building a CI/CD pipeline to automate the deployment of APIs into Azure API Management. Learn about common automation challenges with API Management and how the suggested approach addresses these challenges.  For a demonstration,

value.title: How to choose which services to use in Azure | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this video, Azure MVP Barry Luijbregts chats with Scott Hanselman about how he goes about choosing the right services in Azure to run his applications and store his data. value.title: How to create a load balancer | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to configure load balancers and how to add virtual machines to them in the Azure Portal. value.title: How to set up an Azure pipeline with Node JS | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to create an Azure Pipeline for a Node.js application. Setting up a continuous integration process that automatically builds and tests your node.js code is very easy with Azure pipelines.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips

value.title: How to use Azure Automation with PowerShell | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to use Azure Automation with a Windows Machine with PowerShell. Azure Automation makes it easy to do common tasks like, scaling Azure SQL Database up and down and starting and stopping a virtual machine.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips

value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to use Cost Management to understand your cloud spend. value.title: Introducing new Azure API Management capabilities | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Miao Jiang joins Scott Hanselman discuss the API economy and how companies must master the challenges inherent in building, maintaining, managing, and exposing APIs to participate. That's where Azure API Management can help. Azure API Management is a solution for publishing APIs to external and internal

value.title: Process and Translate Speech with Azure Cognitive Speech Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement the Speech services found in Azure Cognitive Services by performing speech-to-text transcription, synthesize text input to speech, perform speech translation, and implement speaker recognition in your AI infused applications

topItems.title: Transcribe speech input to text
topItems.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

topItems.title: Translate speech with the speech service
topItems.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.title: Add and size disks in Azure virtual machines
value.excerpt: Learn about your virtual machine storage options and how to choose between standard and premium, managed and unmanaged disks for your Azure virtual machine.

value.title: Allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset
value.excerpt: Learn how to allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset.

value.title: Analyze costs and create budgets with Azure Cost Management
value.excerpt: Learn how to use cost analysis to understand how your costs accrue each month.
